      • noOfInputs

        public int noOfInputs()
        Note that the no of inputs for a constant function does not matter as it will output the same constant irrespective of the input.
        Specified by:
        noOfInputs in interface Function
        Returns:
        the no of inputs = 1 (by default)

      • operate

        public double operate(double... param)
        Description copied from interface: Function
        Operates on the given set of inputs and returns the result of the operation. This is the elixir of the concept of functions.
        Specified by:
        operate in interface Function
        Parameters:
        param - to be operated on
        Returns:
        the result of the operation or Double.NaN if expected number of parameters is not found (if it matters).

      • derivatives

        public double[] derivatives(double... param)
        Description copied from interface: Function
        Returns the partial derivatives of this function with respect to its parameters as an array of Function
        Specified by:
        derivatives in interface Function
        Parameters:
        param - point of tangency
        Returns:
        array of partial derivative values, null if the expected no of parameters is not found
